commit.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to do something wrong or illegal
commit.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Women commit fewer crimes than men.
Brady committed a series of brutal murders.
commit.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to say that someone will definitely do something or must do something
commit.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: He has clearly committed his government to continuing down the path of economic reform.
Meeting them doesn’t commit us to anything.
I’d committed myself and there was no turning back.
The banks have committed themselves to boosting profits by slashing costs.
commit.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to give someone your love or support in a serious and permanent way
commit.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Anna wants to get married, but Bob’s not sure he wants to commit.
He has not yet committed to any of the candidates.
commit.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to decide to use money, time, people etc for a particular purpose
commit.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: A lot of money has been committed to this project.
commit.translation[0].definitions[4].def: to send someone to be tried in a court of law
commit.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: The two men were committed for trial at Bristol Crown Court.
commit.translation[0].definitions[5].def: to order someone to be put in a hospital or prison
commit.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: The judge committed him to prison for six months.
commit.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: People who commit crimes end up in jail.
The couple were accused of committing murder.
She later admitted committing the robbery.
commit an act of violence/terrorism/aggression etc
Anyone committing an act of terrorism will be severely punished.
He was accused of committing treason against the King of England.
In some countries, genocide is being committed every day.
During the civil war both sides committed numerous atrocities.
He confessed to having committed the sin of adultery.
commit.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to say that someone will definitely do something or must do something
commit.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: He committed his government to support Thailand’s traditional free-market system.
Sorry, I’ve already committed myself to working for Clive.
She would not want to commit to anything that would last more than a year.
commit.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to decide to use money, time, people etc for a particular purpose
commit.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: A client needs to approve an idea before committing resources to it.
commit.translation[1].definitions[2].def: to do something wrong or illegal
commit.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: We are confident that we have not committed any fraud.
